name: Search ideas for melee PvP build
author: Earthcore

posts.author: Earthcore
posts.content:
Hello,

I'm very please to find such a dedicated community on NWN after all this years !!
I'm coming back to the game after a 13 years diet and was searching a french server ... there are not a lot now :( but I found a FR PW and it allows several interesting subraces : http://nwnecbguild.forumer.com/topic/23 ... 5PrWEuLTRY

I'm interested on a melee character PvP oriented andI prefer rough classes like monk, pal, fighter, WM, rogue ... you see :)

I thought of a full monk Illithid, a fighter/rogue/WM Vampire, an Aasimar pal/WM/monk fighting armorless with a scythe (so cool !!!) but haven't the knowledge to make a good PvP build with that :(
According to the opportunities those sub races offer and your knowledge in char building do you have ideas of a huge PvP build ?

I don't know is the characteristics given by the sub races count in the +12 limit ... they appear in green in the character sheet
I have no idea if it is possible to change alignment.
The server seems at least medium magic ... I think medium is a good basis.
The XP system may be very slow ...

Many thanks for our ideas !

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Welcome back after a long hiatus!  Yup, we are still here... more or less.  The ranks have thinned significantly but the durable persist and new players seem to pop out of the woodwork thanks to the digital market places like GoG.  Now to your search...

First off, you'll need to both translate and capsulize any subrace modifications.  I speak and read a little Spanish but as far as French goes... it's beyond my means. c'est la vie! That ends my fluency in French.

Typically, the subraces apply ability modifications just like the standard NWN racial bias.  It has no effect on the ability cap via buffs and/or gear.  But how YOUR server handles it?  Only you would know that recipe.

As to building for PvP... decide the class you are planning to duel and build accordingly.  There is no such thing as a one-size-fits-all PvP build.  Using your monk as an example, you could surely create a mage killer by vesting heavily in SR feats but that would weaken that same toon vs. heavy fighter types.  In the same respect, if you know you are going against a smiter... pally, blackguard and assassin are poor choices (depending on your opponent's class, naturally).  Vs. WM or any DevCritter, any palemaster build pretty much pulls the rug out from under them easily.  You get the idea.  "Horses for courses." an old racetrack tenet.  Same rationale here.

So, decide on your most likely duel focus and build to that optimization.  Once you have dominated those classes, then begin working on another type.  Then you can log whichever one counters your opponent best and have faith that your due diligence will produce fruit. 

Finally, if the server is very slow leveling, you may need to party up or the build's potential may become painfully difficult to implement.  Most PvP builds reach their optimization very late in the build sequence so you may need help from others to achieve your goal. Depends on the characteristics that you will face in the PvM portion of the exercise.

So, is this a 40 level cap server?  That seems a logical place to start the exposition.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Earthcore wrote:
According to my toon, I don't want to be heavy focused against a certain type (caster/melee/sneaker) and awfull against another.

 
I wish that were possible. Trust me. No matter what you build, you will do miserable against the right counter. From playing years of duelers... it's just a plain fact. The most obvious counter to any evil dueler is simply a dedicated CHA-focused pally CoT smiter that will rip your epic warding to shreds with over 2K damage and an AB that will overcome your AC rather easily.  There is always a counter.  Generally speaking, the most reliable PvP toons are divine AAs and battle priests but even that depends on the magic level.  As SR ratings of opponents increase (as seems to be the case on this server), saves are escalated and Mords are spammed,  spellcasting/self-buffing loses its value and you'll begin to see mainly WMs and any high-APR, high crit damage builds (like scythers). 

BTW... is that illithid SR 25 + 1/level able to breached or is it the same sort as Diamond Soul?  Big difference, potentially.

Since you seem reluctant to declare a focus, we can then assume you will be battling a mirror, a similar illithid with the same limitations.  So then the issue becomes:  How are you going to gain some edge? 
I imagine a very good AC (monk ?), SR/immunities could easily provided by sub race, a very high listen skill would be nice.
 
It depends. Has DevCrit been nerfed on this server?  How about Terrifying Rage (not a factor for this subrace obviously)?  If not, you'd be better off DWing kamas with a STR build (trying to finesse them concurrently would gimp your AB badly since you need to reach STR25 and cannot afford to split your prime AB ability i.e. DEX).  Else, finesse the DW kamas while you optimize your AC potential.  But no Epic Dodge with Wiz/Monk and with only GMW and Flame Weapon to enhance your damage (assuming the opponents does not have enough fire resistance to thwart that bonus).

I only see a few choices: Monk15/Wiz25 to get relative indispellability (except Mords), decent recipro shield, diamond soul (you'll need that to reach complete SR 67 with your subrace), quivering palm and good monk AC/move speed bonus.  Else, higher level monk with Monk25/Wiz15 for even more AC/move speed but easily dispelled GMW/Flame weapon/Keen edge buffs or finally, a high-mage Wiz34/Monk6 using the Iron Golem polymorph in combo with monk progression for the prime melee presence.  Naturally, the more mage levels, the lower the BAB so your APR will suffer.

Keep in mind that any standard monk/fighter/WM will pwn this subrace with its superior AB, APR and crit multiplier.
Spoiler [+]

You should probably post this info as a dedicated topic within the Persistent Worlds subforum. Call the topic "Solarune" or whatever the server's name is. That way, when you post any future requests, all you need to do is link the topic (i.e. use that little chain icon just abobve the text color icon in the editor) instead of repeating this list over and over so folks have easy access. Include any other custom features like class, feat and spell changes while you are at it.
